Review Title: A day in the ancient world with an eye to the future
Review Text: The beach conveys atmosphere of the past with a look to the future. To the images of fatigue of fishermen engaged relentlessly in daily work you see young couples walking on the beautiful endless beach. Everyone responds with smiles and nods to your greeting in harmony with the quiet undertow of the ocean. Time flows under a centuries-old tree that refreshes you courteously from the tropical heat. You leave everything behind you, you only look forward, with serenity.
Here's a single dump. Plastic and cans everywhere. It's hard to believe but so you can ruin beauty from
The beach itself was lovely and well-maintained. Nevertheless, the rough sea made it challenging to fully enjoy a swim, especially with the uneven sea bed causing further difficulty.
For a solitaire who just needs nothing stands around him and the ocean, there's no better option .Take a walk along the beach towards the promontory and the memory would last a lifetime..

Review Title: Place to enjoy, undistrubed beach experience
Review Text: Nice place to see another peaceful beach in Batticaloa . Pls go on any day than Sunday if you are a peaceful person. if you like crowd,,,make sure to be there on Sundays

Take your walk from the center of town ,towards the clock tower, then turn right and walk along the old iron bridge .Once you have passed the bridge for about few hundred feet, turn left near Saravana Bhawan [a restaurant] and walk straight on, for another few hundred feet. Trust me this long walk will add to the feel you are searching for. Once you reach the beach the first feeling might be somewhat underwhelming , but this first impression is not the reality. Walk to your left along the paved road for about 1km and you would find the bliss .Think of a moment and place where its just you, sea and no one else around. You will find it here. Keep on walking till the edge of promontory if you have time. This is beyond Kallady beach but who cares. Nawalady beach is for those who want the whole vista for themselves. Serendipity.

Review Title: A beautiful beach in the east coast.
Review Text: Apart from diving and sea bathing area offers a few things.  The beach was very beautiful. A bit lonely. A handful of tourists can be seen relaxing. Some tourists and the dive center arranged clean ups.  The people in the area need to be aware of the pollution. The floods rain too bring rubbish to the beach. Authorities need to focus the attention to keep the beaches clean. One more thing I noticed. The large village nets so called MAA Dal is being used. They do not get enough harvest for the efforts. People are very friendly All in all if you need to relax this is the place.

I would not recommend this beach for swimming. The waves are big (at least when I was there in February) and there are signs advising against going in the water. Also, I did not feel comfortable being in a bikini on the beach since everyone else is fully dressed. Nice place for a walk though.
Wonderful place to Relax Most Evening I spent my free time here with local community people very friendly, helpful and Safe please
100% natural eco, very clean beach and your can see Tsunami memories. No any other place to replace this zone

Very calm and tranquil place. One of the cleanest beaches I have seen in Sri Lanka. Beach spans across a vast area and yet its hard to spot any garbage lying around. Not suitable for bathing. Best visit in evenings or early mornings. Good place to witness sunrise.

I don't know if it's just the part of the beach that we visitied at the Northern (Kallady Bridge) end, but I was disappointed. The approach is through a sea of rubbish: though the beach itself is clean near the sea, there are plastic bottles strewn over the sand. There was nowhere obvious for something to eat or drink. But the sea was gorgeous and warm and the sand gorgeous
Very beautiful beach in Eastern province Sri Lanka. Just 2km from Batticaloa town. Very relaxing place to spend an evening with your family.

'Cherish' is the song which hums in when the solitary walk is taken when the sun is in the western sky. Entire beach is almost deserted ,save for a couple of tourists and few fisherman .This isthmus which is home to the Kallady beach is sparsely populated all the way to the promontory .Story has it that this picturesque beach once housed a tiny colony of Srilankans -all direct descendants of the Portuguese  Virtually the entire community perished in the morning of Tsunami .The memorial to them add to the sentimentality of the evening when the sun is about and hour to set. Kallady is among the most romantic beaches of Srilanka .Its clean and safe . Cool and the Gang never came to Kallady .Not sure about the guy who wrote the song however.
If you are a beach lover, this place is perfect for you. The beach is almost empty and a great place to relax. In the morning you can watch the fishermen go out to the sea.
The beach is much smaller than it was due to erosion.  But still a great hang out place for a pleasant evening.
Never miss the sunrise enjoying from this beach. You can see the fishing boats returning form the sea & busy fishermen. The beach is big enough to have children's activities.

A must visit place in Batticaloa. Beautiful huge clean beach. Best time to go in the morning or evening to see the sunset. Very clean and well maintained. Waves are very rough and not recommended to take bath.

Excellent place in batticaloa and we can go to this place via boat and vehicle also. My selection is boat. charges only for boat other all are free. When we go to the beach both sides lagoon and see. Nice experience with my friends i had
It is a beautiful beach in the east cost of Sri Lanka. Nice place to spend your evening and enjoy the sunset.
Nice ocean but the waves where very very strong today.... we could not go in. It looks abandon. Not a lot of people...

Lets get one thing straight - I'm not a swimmer. The Kallady Beach is perfect for people like me who would go and soak up the sun, without heading too far out into the ocean. The Kallady Beach is virtually on the continental shelf. Venture six to ten feet out into the ocean here and the water gets very deep, very fast! For Suba Divers, Kallady Beach offers, by all reports, a couple of excellent wrecks to dive on, a fair distance from the beach itself. Not being much of a diver either, the reader should check this on Google!
This is a few beach to spend time in Batticaloa.This is a average beach.This is a place here for you to spend the evenings.

There is not much to do in Batticaloa and if you are here you are here to relax at the sea and this would your best bet. A long stretch of beach hat just seems to go on forever. I was here in February so not a tourist season, the sea was rough and you could just not think of getting into the water. And no crowds in February literally had the entire stretch of the sea to myself.
your pretty standard Sri lankan beach, can get crowded at times, go around 4 or 5 when the sun goes down as it pretty unforgiving.

We are a family with small kids (6 and 7). We went there in the afternoon 2 times and we also went into the water. There are waves and the kids need to use some swimming helpers as usual. The sand ist very find also in the water. You can go a bit away from the local beach area and there you are alone. The local area is unfortunately spoiled with some plastic litter like almost all places in Sri Lanka without extra cleaning people. But after you pass that it is beautiful. Bring your own food, water and shade if you need, as there is no touristic infrastructure. But that makes is special.
Kallady beach is a one of the landmark of batticaloa.nice environment .every sunday evening large number of  people are gathering for enjoy their weekends.
a long beach with few people. Fishing boats. Seaside temple, with another bearing the impact of the tsunami, being shifted & tilted. Many of seaside homes rebuilt.

Went there on evening time.. It was nice.. Small kids were playing with kites on the sky.. Lots of families were sitting there and having a free and relaxed time on the beach...when night falls something starts to glowing on the beach.. Some say its small creatures..some say its some animal stuff..i don't know..but it was a nice experience..for my luck it was a full moon day..so i enjoyed my visit... I prefer the evening time to visit here...
The beach is not clean at all now. The beach is very narrow comparatively to the other eastern beaches. The color of the sea is not that attractive. Probably because we went on a rainy day.

This is an interesting place to see the locals out enjoying themselves.  After school the mothers bring their children down for an ice-cream or to enjoy themselves on the play equipment.  The older boys play volleyball or beach cricket, and the mothers watch the children or watch the waves.  Too dangerous to swim for me - and for the locals.  No one was in the water when we were there despite the heat.  Nice fishing boats, but pity the beach is so badly littered with rubbish.

One of lovely beaches situated at batticalo . Children could enjoy much with sand play. Few were had sea bath. We were scared of bad whether forcast. Otherwise it is another lovely beaches in Sri Lanka and easy to travel from town

This place is popular among the locals. Beautiful sandy beach but people are throwing garbage everywhere even though there are bins. There have been many incidents and deaths because of the high waves and circular currents. Be caution if you are not a good swimmer.
Beach is really nice and have great views to the sea. You will also find fishing boats and fishemen there. Its a long beach and you can find places which are crowded and also very much isolated.
Nice beach to relax at with the family and have a BBQ with close family and close relative at night.
It's one of the virgin beach in Sri Lanka.Nice place to enjoy.It's clean and good surroundings.Week ends and full moon days local people visit here.
Kalladyg beach frontage is a beautiful place to visit. Lot's of local visitors have thrown plastic bags and garbage all over the place. The municipality has to take action and keep the beach clean.
Cows roaming around a pretty beach with a few tourist and a few locals and fisherman def worth a visit.

There are really two parts to this beach. The first, the section adjacent to the access road and parking lot, is where most local people go. There's a dilapidated boardwalk linking several run-down wooden gazebos and, at one end, what used to be a children's playground; the odd bit of broken playground equipment is still there. All of this was constructed a few years after the tsunami, and has been neglected since. Further along, after the boardwalk, is the other, undeveloped part of the beach. Fewer people come here. Walk far enough (half a kilometer?) and you will end up at the tsunami-destroyed Kallady Thiruchchunther temple (it's amongst a grove of trees). The beach has a lot of litter. Part of this is swept in by the tides; you'll find soda bottles from Thailand and Malaysia, for example. Some of the trash is left behind by the fishermen who use the beach, and part by littering locals. There are few, if any trash bins to be found so please walk your trash out with you. However, if you can ignore the garbage, it's a lovely place that few people, tourist or local, go to. A word of warning: there are very strong rip tides at Kallady Beach, and people drown here every year. So unless you are a strong swimmer who knows what to do if caught in a rip tide, I recommend you stay out of the water.

This is one of the many beached that tourists have not yet discovered.  Some local holiday makers have thrown plastic bags and garbage.  During the day time the beach and the surroundings look great.  Keep your vluables in the hotel.  Nice place for sea bathing.

Nice place, good for all ages, relaxing and peace in mind place. Recommend for all to spend few minutes to relax and stress out your busy life, good for health (physically) and mind, good to go with family. All the best
Like most beaches in Sri-Lanka this beach too is a nice place.Check up before swimming as sometimes the sea can be rough. Must make a visit if you happen to come to Batticaloa.
Quiet beach with peaceful surroundings. You can watch fisherman return from the sea with their night's catch and even help them if you'd like. Best place to swim and work on your tan.
Nice long stretch of empty beach was told it was quite safe to swim here but did not bother best to see it before the concrete blight takes hold.

Though the site is so beautiful but no one taking care of cleaning up properly. Good place for diving, walk around especially at morning or evening hours. You can see the beauty of Batti, traditional way of fishing, and Eastern lagoon here.
We were unlucky with the seasonal weather, which triggered abnormally high waves and dangerous swimming conditions. It may also have led to the very high volume of rubbish washed up on the beach.
The beach area is unkempt and a lot of garbage lying around. But a beutiful beach.swimming is not advisable here. Very scenic.
I stayed and dived at the deep sea resort and after noon was at leisure. I went for a walk and found this natural; beach.  Foreign investors and hotel owners have not yet found this virgin beach
If you want a beach all to yourself look no further. But everything you need with you as all there is there is empty sand and sea
A rather well kept secret this beautiful beach in Batticaloa ideal for a early morning stroll. Not very clean though as there were discarded bottles and plastic. Advisable not to go there after dark.
best experience during sunrise. Was effected severely during the Tsunami. Village folks very friendly.

In the weekend or on festivaldays it may be busy, but for the rest of the week you have kilometres of sand all alone for you.  When I visited, there was one guy with a tuk-tuk who was selling cool refreshments.  I didn’t see another café or restaurant. The beach was also cleaned before I arrived, so I had no problems walking barefoot on the sand.

Nice beach you can enjoy if you go on a normal day.Unfortunately the day we visited it, there was a kite festival with a cultural show.Massive crowds with lot of vehicles. Managed to catch the beautiful scenery of a colorful evening sky with a calm sea. Please check  for any festivals or activities before visiting the beach,to avoid inconvenience. otherwise it is a nice beach to enjoy with family & friends.

I visited this beach for a short period of time during evening. Really beautiful and nice place to stay. But be aware while walking on the sand, sometimes there are glass particles which can injure you.
very big and no tourist beach, fishermen go out in the evening, nice to see the action, the bad part is that the beach is really dirty, a lot of broken glass, so beware your feet...
Super beach, the beach was totally isolated, there was no one around. we were only there for a hour .

We took a night train from Colombo arriving at 4am to Batti. we took tuk tuk to Kallady Beach and spent 2 hours until sunrise. was really beautyful experience! tuk tuk waited for us and than took us to Sunrise for awesome breakfast. tuktuk driver took 400rs and we were all happy

I had the privilege of living in Batticaloa for 3 months, and I loved the Kallady beach. I would walk here from the Batticaloa city centre on some early mornings to watch the sunrise. It is usually empty and a great place to relax. As the morning progresses, watch the fishermen go out to sea and the local kids come out to play on the beach. Take a walk along the road parallel to the beach to see the destruction from the 2004 tsunami, and spend a quiet moment at the monuments erected to remember the victims from young and old. Do keep in mind that this is not a touristy area, and it's best that you are properly dressed to respect the local culture.

Kallady beach is one of the most stunning beaches in sri lanka. The batticaloa beaches are generally more nicer than all the beaches in south and west sri lanka. Kallady beach is one of the nicest in Batticaloa District. Its said that it is dangerous for swimming. Thats not true! we were swimming every day and its not dangerous at all.

Kallady beach is one of the beautiful beaches I have visited in east coast of Sri Lanka. Very scenic view with sea, beach and fishing boats. Little children play area is also present nearby and there are some ruins due to tsunami of 2005 too. Must visit place while at Batticaloa.
